intro: Melampyrum sylvaticum subsp. intermedium, commonly known as the intermediate flameweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic plants. The species is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, reddish-orange flowers. Its leaves are opposite and lanceolate, often with a slightly hairy texture. This subspecies is typically found in shaded woodland areas and thrives in moist, well-drained soils.
